lp Cyclonus in what ever he needs" replied the predacon Commander

e  mistake and all would go to the pit. "I'll tell you after solve some urg=
ent issues... Start to evaluate damages and repair this base... Scourge, gi=
ve me a full report when you finish".

ydras is doing that on

Cyclonus nodded as he glanced over at Sco=
urge and Scorponok. Cyclonus
was not an engineer, but he was originally tra=
ined as a saboteur,
which means he knew a lot about how things worked, even=
 if it was
geared more for destruction then repairs. He was never quite sur=
e why
Unicron had crafted him with these skills, but there were times when
=
they did come in handy . . . like now.

Pointing back in the direction they=
 had come, Cyclonus gestured at a
few holes in the walls Scourge had create=
d when he had attempted to
hit Rat Trap. "Those are yours, make sure that t=
he walls are seamless
when you are done."

Scourge nodded and walked toward=
s the first hole grumbling under his
breath, "Dirty Maximal scum, now I hav=
e to clean up after his filth
... <grumble> <grumble>"

Cyclonus looked ove=
r at Scorponok, "The torture chamber is yours. Seal
up the hole that was ma=
de, and find out how he got in in the first
place."

"What?!?! You do not t=
ell ME what to do!" Scorponok's anger blazed
against Cyclonus.

However rat=
her than respond, Cyclonus just calmly walked away, almost
as if daring Sko=
rponok to shoot him.

Scorponok's guns trained on Cyclonus, but then he gla=
nced over at

with
walked inside the torture room and slammed the door!

Cyclonus himself=
 continued walking without breaking stride. Although
his back was to Skorpo=
nok, he had never taken his attention from the
larger Decepticon, until Sko=
rponok enter the chamber and slammed the
door.

Cyclonus continued towards =
the computer room where he would
investigate what other damage, if any Rat =
trap had done to the
